body:
### Problem

In the bad old days when `netrw` was used, it was possible to configure the callback to `gx` command with the variable `vim.g.netrw_browsex_viewer` and it was possible to stuff almost anything there. So, I had in my configuration

```lua
vim.g.netrw_browsex_viewer='setsid osurl'
```

where [`osurl`](https://git.sr.ht/~mcepl/vim-suse-changes/tree/master/item/osurl) is a short bash script preprocessing [SUSE common abbreviations](https://en.opensuse.org/openSUSE:Packaging_Patches_guidelines#Current_set_of_abbreviations). The result is that when I run `gx` on one of those abbreviations (e.g., `gh#neovim/neovim#29443`) it would expand the abbreviation to the full URL (`https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29443`) and open that URL with `xdg-open`.

`vim.ui.open` doesnâ€™t have any such extension capability, but it should be relatively easy to do so:

```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/ui.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/ui.lua
index f168da4955..cf92accd2a 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/ui.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/ui.lua
@@ -141,7 +141,9 @@ function M.open(path)
 
   local cmd --- @type string[]
 
-  if vim.fn.has('mac') == 1 then
+  if vim.fn.executable(vim.g.netrw_browsex_viewer) == 1 then
+    cmd = { vim.g.netrw_browsex_viewer, path}
+  elseif vim.fn.has('mac') == 1 then
     cmd = { 'open', path }
   elseif vim.fn.has('win32') == 1 then
     if vim.fn.executable('rundll32') == 1 then
```

(of course, `vim.g.netrw_browsex_viewer` is just a legacy placeholder some better name should be found)

### Expected behavior

See above
title: Make the command run in `vim.ui.open` configurable
